subject: Creativity
title: Rapid Prototyping: Build to Think, Not to Ship
description: A quick win: understand Rapid Prototyping: Build to Think, Not to Ship.

hook.text: The first iPhone prototype was a block of wood with a paper screen.

buildup.text: Prototypes aren't products. They're questions in physical form: 'Does this size feel right?

discovery.text: IDEO's rule: 'If a picture is worth a thousand words, a prototype is worth a thousand meetings.

twist.text: The goal of a prototype is to fail fast. Each failure teaches something a meeting never could.

climax.text: Google's Sprint method builds and tests a prototype in just five days ‚Äî answering critical business questions before.

punchline.text: Don't build to ship. Build to learn. Shipping comes later.

quiz.question: What is the primary purpose of a rapid prototype?
options: To learn and test assumptions cheaply
